result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Merritt A. Parks

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Statement, Confession Or Admission
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Atty Masana received and waives reading of Information, stands mute.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for trial.

2:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Court quashes warrant.  State does not object to reinstating previous bond.  Court reinstates previous bond.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.

11:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Merritt A. Parks not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Merritt A. Parks.  Atty Masana has no record to make.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:20 PM Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana advises matters are not resolved.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
No presence upon bars, taverns or liquor stores; Absolute Sobriety

Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date on April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:34 PM Defendant Merritt A. Parks in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Markoski.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Merritt A. Parks appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint. DE does qualify for PD representation, Atty. Masana is on other cases.   Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests $ Signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No presence upon bars, taverns or liquor stores; Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
